clinical_study.brief_title: Point-of-Choice Prompts to Reduce Prolonged Sitting Time at Work
clinical_study.official_title: Point-of-Choice Prompts to Reduce Prolonged Sitting Time at Work: A Randomised Trial

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to determine whether an on-screen prompt put on the work computer every 30 minutes is effective in getting office workers to reduce prolonged periods of sitting at work.

detailed_description.textblock: Prolonged bouts of uninterrupted time spent sitting is associated with indicators of poor health, independent of how physically active a person is. Many occupations are now sedentary, and are characterised by long periods spent sitting at a desk. Brief education on the benefits of standing regularly and breaking up prolonged sitting will be provided to participants, working at a Scottish University. One intervention group will additionally have software installed on their work computer which placed a prompt window in the centre of their screen for 1 minute every 30 minutes. The prompt will remind participants to stand-up and take a break, and the window cannot be removed or minimised.

primary_outcome.description: total time spent sitting in continuous uninterrupted prolonged (>30minutes) sitting events at work

secondary_outcome.description: total time spent sitting while at work
total number of uninterrupted sitting events (of any duration) during work
total number of steps taken while at work
the duration of breaks between sitting events
total time spent walking at work
total time spent standing while at work
the number of continuous uninterrupted prolonged (>30minutes) sitting events during work

arm_group.description: A short educational talk, read from a script, regarding the health risks of prolonged sitting, stating that standing every 30 minutes could be beneficial. A short information leaflet with the same message is also provided.

A short educational talk, read from a script, regarding the health risks of prolonged sitting, stating that standing every 30 minutes could be beneficial. A short information leaflet with the same message is also provided. Prompting software (MyRestBreak 1.0 copyright Vikram Sharma) will be installed on the work computer. A prompt with the message "stand up, take a break" is placed on the screen of the work computer for 1 minutes every 30 minutes, from the time the computer is switched on in the morning. The prompt is contained in a window 11x9 cm in the centre of the screen. The prompt cannot be removed or minimised, but work can continue in any windows visible around the prompt. The prompt is on the computer for 5 days.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Employee of Glasgow Caledonian University
- Aged between 18 and 65 years
- Self-reported desk-based occupation
- Informed written consent provided
- Ability to stand unassisted
Exclusion Criteria:
- Any musculoskeletal condition which limits ability to stand regularly
